#summary The rel="nofollow" attribute indicates that the author of the current document does not endorse the referenced document.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute,from-w3c

`rel="nofollow"` is one of several [LinkTypes link types] for describing relationships between documents.

== Usage ==

[http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2005/01/preventing-comment-spam.html Google says], "when Google sees the attribute `rel=nofollow` on hyperlinks, those links won't get any credit when we rank websites in our search results."

== Elements ==

You can use the `rel="nofollow"` attribute on these elements:

  * [AElement <a>]
  * [AreaElement <area>]

|| *Test* || *IE8* || *IE7* || *FF3* || *FF2* || *Saf3* ||
